intro: Satureja dentata, commonly known as Italian savory, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are used in cooking and traditional medicine for their pungent, slightly peppery flavor. Satureja dentata is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract beneficial insects.
